column1: A febrile seizure is a convulsion in a child triggered by a fever.
Febrile seizures often run in families.
Ear infections, a cold or viral illness may trigger a febrile seizure.
The health care provider may diagnose febrile seizure if the child has a grand mal seizure but does not have a history of seizure disorders (epilepsy).
With a typical febrile seizure, the examination usually is normal, other than symptoms of the illness causing the fever.
